name: N-(3-chlorophenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4014
Reason:
3-Chlorophenyl group: The introduction of a 3-chlorophenyl group increases the melting point due to the additional rigidity and molecular weight. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
Fluorine substituents: The trifluoromethyl group (–F–F–F) adds rigidity and molecular weight, contributing approximately +20°C. The fluorine atoms also increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5°C each.
